topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Deploy the SSL Certificate Alternate Name Patch

body.section: This patch fixes a problem with the HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade certificate. There is no Subject Alternate Name (SAN) specified in the certificate and is malformed as a result.

section.title: Prerequisite
section.p: This patch requires the SSL patch (HCG2.0_Heat001_Patch003) to be applied first.
To download the patch you need from the Software Updates and Licensing site, shown above:

ol.li: Select the required patch file (e.g. ) from the Downloads list and then click Download.

Un-tar the downladed files (compressed patch files with extension tar.gz and .tar) until the kcp-ssl-cert-v3.patch, knc-ssl-cert-v3.patch and readme files are available. The readme with the patch download contains information on files changed by these patches.The Software Licensing site lists and displays patch file names individually for all the three versions of HCG ( HCG_1.1, HCG_2.0 and HCG_2.1) under Software Specification and Download filename. Regardless of their version number, these files are referencing the same files as extracted in the readme.

Check if the MD5 checksum verification file is extracted along with the patch file.
For validating the integrity of the downloaded file, you can run the MD5 checksum verification on the downloaded patch file and verify if the fingerprint of the file matches the version available on the server.

Log onto the lifecycle manager VM.ssh <lifecycle manager_VM_IP>
where: lifecycle manager_VM_IP is the CLM IP of the lifecycle manager. Locate the IP address for the lifecycle manager in the /root/infra-ansible-playbooks/group_vars/all file under hlm_clmstaticip field.
Copy the knc-ssl-cert-v3.patch and kcp-ssl-cert-v3.patch files to the ~/ directory.
Execute the following command to deploy the patch: patch -p1 < ../kcp-ssl-cert-v3.patch
Execute the following command to deploy the patch: patch -p1 < ../knc-ssl-cert-v3.patch
Execute the following command to integrate the changes into the environment:./hlm_prepare-env.sh

Execute the following command:hlm generate -c <cloud name>
Where <cloud name> is the name of your cloud.
Execute the following command to redeploy the Horizon UI: hlm deploy -c <cloud name> -t "FND-CLU FND-STN HZN-WEB WR-HZN"
Change to the KVM region configuration directory cd /var/hlm/clouds/<cloud name>/desired_state wrloc=$(find . -name windriver-config -type d| head -n 1); cd $wrloc
Make a backup of the original server-cert.pem key.
Copy contents of cakey.pem file into the server-cert.pem key available in /etc/ssl/private/ on the active and standby KVM region controllers.
Restart haproxy on active controller: service haproxy restart
